Name: Bronze figure of an ibis
Description: Bronze figure of an ibis on a pedestal. The ibis was often used to depict the god Thoth, patron of writing and knowledge. From the Late Period to the Roman Period the Egyptians mummified millions of the birds, and buried them in catacombs around the country. The votive bronzes are part of the same belief system: many bear the name of the devotee, with a prayer for long life from the god.
